feed.title: Google Cloud: Media CDN
feed.subtitle: Changelog for Google Cloud product: Media CDN

entry.content:
Media CDN supports multipart range requests, which enable users to request multiple non-contiguous segments of a file in a single HTTP request. This feature is in Preview.

For more information, see Multipart range requests.
entry.summary: Media CDN now supports multipart range requests, allowing users to fetch multiple file segments in one go. This feature is currently in Preview.
entry.title: Feature: Multipart range requests now in Preview

entry.content:
You can use Autonomous System Numbers (ASN) based rules from Cloud Armor for Media CDN. ASN-based rules allow you to create security policies that specifically permit or deny traffic based on the ASN of the client requesting your content. This feature is Generally Available.

For more information, see Google Cloud Armor support.
entry.summary: You can now use ASN-based rules for Media CDN. This feature allows you to create security policies that permit or deny traffic based on the client's ASN. It is now Generally Available.
entry.title: Feature: ASN-based rules for Media CDN

entry.content:
You can use Network Threat Intelligence (NTI) from Cloud Armor in Edge Security Policies for Media CDN edge cache services for Enterprise users. NTI helps identify and block requests originating from known malicious IP addresses and networks. This feature is Generally Available.

For an example, see Example: Block traffic from known malicious IPs.

For more information, see Google Cloud Armor support.
entry.summary: Enterprise users can now leverage Network Threat Intelligence (NTI) from Cloud Armor in Edge Security Policies for Media CDN edge cache services. This feature, now Generally Available, helps identify and block requests from known malicious IP addresses and networks.
entry.title: Feature: Network Threat Intelligence Now Available for Media CDN

entry.content: Media CDN supports a dedicated range of IPs for requests to external origin servers. IP allowlisting at the origin helps you restrict access to your content by only allowing traffic from Media CDN's IP addresses. This capability is Generally Available.
entry.summary: Media CDN now supports a dedicated range of IPs for requests to external origin servers. This feature is Generally Available.
entry.title: Announcement: IP Allowlisting for External Origins

entry.content: Flexible shielding helps you overcome some limitations of default origin shielding by letting you configure a single, specific geographic region for origin shielding, typically selected to be near your centralized origin. This feature is in Preview.
entry.summary: Flexible shielding lets you select a specific geographic region for origin shielding, useful for origins centralized in one location. This feature is currently in Preview.
entry.title: Feature: Flexible origin shielding is now available
